intro: Psychotria horizontalis subsp. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-green psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves that often display a bluish-green hue. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Psychotria horizontalis subsp. glaucescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
